page.title: Business models for open source software

rev.diff:
Line 34: Line 34:
* [[MySQL]] is offered for free, but with the enterprise version includes support and additional features.
* [[MySQL]] is offered for free, but with the enterprise version includes support and additional features.
* [[Novell]] offers [[openSUSE]] for free through the [[openSUSE Project]], while selling [[SUSE Linux Enterprise]] (SLE).
* [[Novell]] offers [[openSUSE]] for free through the [[openSUSE Project]], while selling [[SUSE Linux Enterprise]] (SLE).
â
* [[Oracle]] - The closed source edition of [[VirtualBox]] (free to use for home-users) must be bought by companies to be used (but there is also an open-source version that can be used by anyone)
+
* [[Oracle]] - [[VirtualBox]] is free and open-source to anyone, but the [[Virtualbox#Features_only_available_with_the_extension_pack|VirtualBox extension pack]] can only be used for free at home, therefore requiring payment for business
* [[Red Hat]] offers the [[Fedora (Linux distribution)|Fedora]] for free through the [[Fedora Project]], while selling [[Red Hat Enterprise Linux]] (RHEL).
* [[Red Hat]] offers the [[Fedora (Linux distribution)|Fedora]] for free through the [[Fedora Project]], while selling [[Red Hat Enterprise Linux]] (RHEL).
* [[Sun Microsystems]] offer [[OpenOffice.org]] for free, while selling [[StarOffice]].
* [[Sun Microsystems]] offer [[OpenOffice.org]] for free, while selling [[StarOffice]].
